page.title: 06Risley Moss
page.content: Risley Moss is a nature reserve which covers 80 hectares.The Visitor Centre and the Moss itself were opened in September 1980.Long ago people used to work all day at the Moss digging out the peat.Now Risley Moss has trees and lots of wildlife.There are hides where you can see birds and foxes too.They have a tall wooden tower so that you can look out over the Moss.The Rangers have walkie-talkie radios so they can speak to each other.They always weasr green and have a badge on their jumpers.Sometimes they have dirty weekends when they collect rubbish and stuff out of the ponds.They come to school and ask us to help.The Rangers cut down trees that have died and plant new ones.They stop weeds from killing the flowers.They look after the wildlife.It's great at Risley Moss Lots of visitors come to see the birds
